meta.name: viewport

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.span: Windsor CSD Schools In Session Remotely Until May 18

Due to an order by New York State, Windsor CSD schools will be in session remotely until May 18th. For the latest updates on the district's response to the Coronavirus pandemic, including guidance from the NYS Education Department on changes to Regents and graduation requirements, please click HERE.

div.h3: ENSURING EACH LEARNER IS FUTURE-READY BY PROVIDING EMPOWERING EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES

span.div: April 16, 2020

As the Windsor Central School District continues to be in session remotely amidst the COVID-19 pandemic, opportunities for free meals next week continue as they have for the past few weeks. You can apply for free school meals at https://www.myschoolapps.com/. If you are a family that needs extra assistance, consider applying for SNAP benefits at https://www.ny.gov/services/apply-snap.
Free breakfast and lunch will continue to be available for grab-and-go pickup next week. The logistics will be the same as in past weeks. Anyone 18 years old and younger can pick up two free meals from 10am-1pm Monday through Thursday at one of three locations. One note, on Thursday, double meals will be available as there will be no meal availability on Friday:
Bell Elementary
Weeks Elementary
Palmer Elementary/Windsor Central Middle School
In addition, students and families can pick up meals at the following locations at the specified times:
Route # 1
• Lester Church - Hoadley Hill Road 11:00 a.m.
• Forestview Mobile Park Community - Brown Road 11:30 a.m.
Route # 2
• Occanum Falls Mobile Home Park - Old Route 17 11:00 a.m
• Creekside Windsor Mobile Home Park - Old Route 17 11:10 a.m
• Pleasant Valley Mobile Home Park - Old Route 17 11:20 a.m.
Route #3
• Kirkwood Mobile Home Park 41 Loughlin Rd. 11:00 a.m.
Route #4
• Anthos Apartments Kirkwood 11:00 a.m.
Route #5
• Kirkview & Roberts Street Apartments Kirkwood - 11:00 a.m.
• Haskins/Daisy Lane Kirkwood - 11:15 a.m.
If your child is experiencing difficulties and is need of mental health supports, please contact your child’s school.
We encourage your family to follow the CDC guidelines (cdc.gov) for keeping safe and minimizing the spread of COVID-19. Medical questions may be directed to the New York State Department of Health Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Hotline: 1-888-364-3065.
For the latest updates from the district on Coronavirus response, please continue to go to:
https://www.windsor-csd.org/CoronavirusInformation.aspx.
April 10 2020

Windsor Central School District
April 6, 2020

New York Governor Andrew Cuomo has extended the closure of schools in the state until April 29th. The New York State Education Department has also cancelled June Regents exams. More guidance from the NYS Education Department will be coming in the coming days.
April 2, 2020

As the COVID-19 pandemic continues to have wide-ranging health and economic impacts, please know that there are opportunities to sign up for free meals. You can apply for free school meals at https://www.myschoolapps.com/. If you are a family that needs extra assistance, consider applying for SNAP benefits at https://www.ny.gov/services/apply-snap.

March 27, 2020
New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced today that all New York schools will be closed until April 15th, when he will re-evaluate the closure.

March 24, 2020

Broome County Executive Jason Garnar signed an emergency order Monday closing all public playgrounds, athletic courts, and sporting fields. You can read the full order here: http://www.gobroomecounty.com/countyexec/release/donationdropoffsite.
March 22, 2020

Students pre-k through 12th grade will have access to PBS educational programming every weekday starting Monday, March 23 on-air & https://wskg.org/category/education/. All students can “Learn-at-Home", whether they have a computer or broadband at home. Also, free ed resources at https://ny.pbslearningmedia.org/.

March 17, 2020

A reminder that students can pick up their personal items and educational materials from their school building on Wednesday, March 18 from 10am-6pm. Families with children in multiple buildings should bring each of their children to their individual school building to pick up their items and materials. Parents do not need to have their children with them to pick up their materials.
Also, students can reference the following webpage for educational, food, and mental health/counseling resources: .https://www.windsor-csd.org/EducationalResourcesDuringCoronavirusClosure.aspx
March 17, 2020
For a list of food resources available, please see below. A pdf document of the information below is available by clicking here.
March 16, 2020

Windsor CSD staff were in their school buildings all day on Monday, March 16th contacting families and working to establish a continuum of education. Many of you received phone calls or messages. If you received a message, please return the call.

div.br: If you believe the contact information the district has for you is out of date, please contact your child’s school. You will be hearing from principals and teachers regarding instructional materials for your children.

Windsor Central School District
March 14, 2020

div.strong: BROOME COUNTY DECLARES STATE OF EMERGENCY

br.strong: WINDSOR CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT WILL BE CLOSED MARCH, 16th through APRIL 13th.

span.div:
Dear Windsor Community,
The Broome County Executive has declared a local state of emergency effective today, March 14, 2020, through April 13, 2020. All Windsor Central Schools will be closed for the duration of this state of emergency, including extra-curricular activities. This includes access to the pool, gyms, fitness center and all other indoor and outdoor spaces. As of today, students will not return to school until April 14, 2020.
The decision to close schools for students is a proactive measure to prevent the spread of the virus to students, their families, and the community. This does not indicate a quarantine of Broome County. Businesses remain open and social distancing guidance should be followed.

div.br: We are currently preparing ways to deliver instructional/academic material to our students either through electronic and/or hardcopy formats. Instruction will look different for different students and grade levels. More information regarding this plan will be available early next week. We will also provide details on how families can receive packaged meals during this time away.

span.div: Information will come directly to you on the district mobile app, website, and through School Messenger phone calls, texts and emails. Please note that NO information will be posted on the district’s social media sites in regard to this issue. This is to ensure that all messages reaching our school community are accurate and that all information in regard to COVID-19 and its direct effect on our school district will come directly from my office.

As always, our commitment to the health, well-being, and education of our students will be our highest priority. If you have any questions, please contact your building principal or my office at 607-655-8216

Sincerely,
Jason A. Andrews, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools
Windsor Central School District
March 13, 2020

Dear Parents, Guardians, Staff, and Community,
In keeping with our commitment to update our community as frequently as possible, I want to share with you the next steps we are taking to address the rapidly-evolving Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Today, after reviewing updated guidance from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the Windsor Central School District will implement the following modifications to our operations. These steps are subject to continuing evaluation.
The following will be in effect beginning this Monday, March 16th through April 14th, and will last through the week of spring break (April 3rd-14th) when we will reassess the situation again:

span.strong: Proactive Practices Taken by the District:

div.br:
Promoting additional hand washing with warm water and soap
Additional sanitizer stations are being added in the buildings
Increased level of cleaning taking place during the day and in the evening
Ordered additional cleaning and sanitizing supplies
Ordered cleaning supplies for devices, keyboards and mice
Buses have been thoroughly disinfected with a certified product, and the district will continue routine disinfection
Deep cleaning of the buildings occured during the break

span.strong: In The Event of Potential School Closure:

br.br:
1. We continue to work closely with New York State and the Broome County Health Department.If we do close
school, the length of any closure will be determined with their guidance.
2. In the event it is determined by the Broome County Health Department a student or staff member attended
school prior to being confirmed as a COVID-19 case, New York State Department of Health requires an
initial 24-hour closure, in order to begin an investigation to determine the contacts that the individual may
have had within the school environment.
3. If we are forced to close for an extended period of time, free breakfast and lunch will be available
to all students 18 and under. We will communicate where the sites will be located, if needed.
4. We are currently working on putting together instructional resources for parents and students to access if
we are forced to close for an extended period of time.

span.div:
The Windsor Central School District will continue to follow directives from the Broome County Health
Department and NYS Department of Education. We will continue to share updates as we have more
information. No matter what arises, our committment to the health, well-being, and education of our students will be our highest priority.
Sincerely,
Jason A. Andrews, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools
Windsor Central School District
March 10, 2020

The school district is closely monitoring the situation and is making the necessary preparations in case the COVID-19 becomes more prevalent in our community. For now, there have been no indications of a Coronavirus outbreak, but that could change as time goes on.

div.br:
We all play a role in reducing the likelihood of a coronavirus outbreak in our school district community. We encourage everyone to practice good habits, including:
-Wash your hands regularly, especially after using the restroom and before preparing or consuming food. Wash for 20 seconds, using soap and hot water. Be sure to also wash your fingertips.
-Avoid coughing or sneezing into your hands or in the air. Always try to cough or sneeze into a tissue, and then throw the tissue away. If you don’t have a tissue, cough/sneeze into your arm.
-As much as you can, avoid touching your eyes, mouth and nose.
-If children are feeling sick, please keep them home from school. Allow them some time to feel better so that they do not risk infecting others.

We will continue to communicate with you in the days and weeks to come. It is possible that we may need to cancel classes if it appears the coronavirus has affected our community in a significant way. This decision would be made following direction from the Broome County Health Department.
As always, the safety of our students, staff and families remains our top priority. We will act out of an abundance of caution to protect everyone’s health and well being.

strong.span: Please see resources and information about the Coronavirus below:

span.div: Broome County Health Department Website
New York State Department of Health website

• Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)
https://www.health.ny.gov/diseases/communicable/coronavirus/
• Travel: Frequently Asked Questions and Answers
https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/faqs.html
• COVID-19: What is Stigma and What Causes It?

br.br:
• Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) - Frequently Asked Questions - Prevention
https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/faq.html#prevention
• Prevention, Treatment of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/about/prevention-treatment.html
In addition, New York has established a Novel Coronavirus Hotline, which can provide additional
information. Call 1-888-364-3065 with questions or concerns about travel and symptoms
Families are also encouraged to follow the CDC’s information for travel, available at
https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/index.html.
